chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: bool
x: bool
m: lb
l: lb

Goal:
(x :: l) ↑ (y :: m) = x || y :: l ↑ m

Premises:
Notation lb := (list bool)
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
lb_meet_cons : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), (x :: l) ↓ (y :: m) = x && y :: l ↓ m
lb_pointwise_cons : forall (f : bool -> bool -> bool) (x : bool) (l : lb) (y : bool) (m : lb), lb_pointwise f (x :: l) (y :: m) = f x y :: lb_pointwise f l m
lb_mask_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_ortho_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
lb_ortho_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0
lb_join_comm : forall l m : lb, l ↑ m = m ↑ l
lb_ortho_cons_inv : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x :: l ⟂ y :: m -> (x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘) /\ l ⟂ m
in_lb_ortho_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> x :: l ⟂ y :: m
map_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (x : A) (l : list A), map f (x :: l) = f x :: map f l
in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
lb_mask_inv_cons : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x :: l ⪯ y :: m -> x ⪦ y /\ l ⪯ m
lb_mask_leb : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
lb_join_right : forall x : lb, nil ↑ x = x
lb_join_left : forall x : lb, x ↑ nil = x
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = a :: nil -> x = nil /\ y = a :: nil \/ x = a :: nil /\ y = nil
Inductive lb_ortho : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_ortho_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⟂ l | in_lb_ortho_1 : forall l : lb, l ⟂ nil | in_lb_ortho_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> x :: l ⟂ y :: m Arguments lb_ortho (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_1 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_ortho_2 [x y]%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
lb_pointwise = fun f : bool -> bool -> bool => fix lb_pointwise (l m : lb) {struct l} : lb := match l with | nil => match m with | nil => nil | _ :: _ => map (f ⟘) m end | x :: l0 => match m with | nil => map (fun x0 : bool => f x0 ⟘) l | y :: m0 => f x y :: lb_pointwise l0 m0 end end : (bool -> bool -> bool) -> lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_pointwise _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope
lb_mask_inv_left : forall (x : bool) (l : lb), x :: l ⪯ nil -> x = ⟘ /\ l ⪯ nil
lb_mask_equiv_cons : forall x y : bool, x = y -> forall x0 y0 : lb, x0 ≂ y0 -> x :: x0 ≂ y :: y0
firstn_cons : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (a : A) (l : list A), firstn (S n) (a :: l) = a :: firstn n l
app_cons_not_nil : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), nil <> x ++ a :: y
nil_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), nil <> x :: l
Inductive NoDup (A : Type) : list A -> Prop := NoDup_nil : NoDup nil | NoDup_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> NoDup (x :: l) Arguments NoDup [A]%type_scope _%list_scope Arguments NoDup_nil _%type_scope Arguments NoDup_cons [A]%type_scope _ [l]%list_scope
nodup_inv : forall (A : Type) (decA : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (k l : list A) (a : A), nodup decA k = a :: l -> ~ In a l
Ascii.N_of_ascii = fun a : Ascii.ascii => let (a0, a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7) := a in Ascii.N_of_digits (a0 :: a1 :: a2 :: a3 :: a4 :: a5 :: a6 :: a7 :: nil) : Ascii.ascii -> BinNums.N Arguments Ascii.N_of_ascii _%char_scope
lb_mask_inv_cons_cons : forall l m : lb, ⟙ :: l ⪯ ⟘ :: m -> False
rev_unit : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a : A), rev (l ++ a :: nil) = a :: rev l
lb_mask_equiv_cons_Proper = fun (x y : bool) (H : x = y) => eq_ind_r (fun x0 : bool => Morphisms.respectful lb_mask_equiv lb_mask_equiv (cons x0) (cons y)) (fun (x0 y0 : lb) (H0 : x0 ≂ y0) => (fun y1 : bool => if y1 as b return (forall x1 y2 : lb, x1 ≂ y2 -> b :: x1 ≂ b :: y2) then fun (x1 y2 : lb) (H1 : x1 ≂ y2) => match H1 with | conj H2 H3 => conj (lb_mask_leb ⟙ ⟙ eq_refl H2) (lb_mask_leb ⟙ ⟙ eq_refl H3) end else fun (x1 y2 : lb) (H1 : x1 ≂ y2) => match H1 with | conj H2 H3 => conj (lb_mask_leb ⟘ ⟘ I H2) (lb_mask_leb ⟘ ⟘ I H3) end) y x0 y0 H...
in_eq : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l : list A), In a (a :: l)
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), In x (filter f l) < -> In x l /\ f x = ⟙
destruct_list : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), {x : A & {tl : list A | l = x :: tl}} + {l = nil}
lb_mask_equiv = fun l m : lb => l ⪯ m /\ m ⪯ l : lb -> lb -> Prop Arguments lb_mask_equiv (_ _)%list_scope
lb_mask_inv_cons_nil : forall l : lb, ⟙ :: l ⪯ nil -> False
in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil
lb_mask_inv_nil : forall l : lb, ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil -> l ⪯ nil
map_eq_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (b : B), map f l = b :: l' -> exists (a : A) (tl : list A), l = a :: tl /\ f a = b /\ map f tl = l'
Ascii.N_of_digits = fix N_of_digits (l : lb) : BinNums.N := match l with | nil => BinNums.N0 | b :: l' => BinNat.N.add (if b then BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH else BinNums.N0) (BinNat.N.mul (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (N_of_digits l')) end : lb -> BinNums.N Arguments Ascii.N_of_digits _%list_scope
